docs.title: Disclaimer
docs.text:
Important Notice

These are my personal notes, collated and made available for everyone to reference. Please note:

  • These notes might contain errors - always double-check what you're reading
  • Content comes from aggregating many different sources
  • I try to explicitly reference original sources, but if I missed something, please let me know

docs.title: Note Templates
docs.text: This directory contains reusable templates for creating consistent notes across the knowledge base.

docs.title: Available Templates
docs.text: Template Use Case Location technical-note.md Programming concepts, tools, technologies dev/, devops/ cloud-service.md AWS, Azure, GCP service documentation cloud/ blog-post.md Blog articles and tutorials blog/posts/ certification-study.md Certification exam prep notes learning/certifications/ project-doc.md Project documentation projects/ cheatsheet.md Quick reference guides cheatsheets/ ctf-writeup.md CTF challenge solutions security/ctf/

docs.title: 1. Copy the Template
docs.text:
Bash
# Example: Create a new Python note
cp docs/_templates/technical-note.md docs/dev/python/decorators.md

docs.title: 2. Update the Frontmatter
docs.text:
Every note should have proper YAML frontmatter:

YAML
---
title: Your Note Title
date:
  created: 2024-01-15
  updated: 2024-01-15
tags:
  - relevant-tag
  - another-tag
---

docs.title: 3. Fill in the Content
docs.text: Replace placeholder text with your actual content. Delete sections you don't need.

docs.title: Template Features
docs.text: All templates support these MkDocs Material features:

docs.title: Admonitions (Callout Boxes)
docs.text:
Markdown
!!! note "Title"
    Content here

!!! tip "Pro Tip"
    Helpful advice

!!! warning "Caution"
    Warning message

!!! danger "Critical"
    Important warning

Available types: note, abstract, info, tip, success, question, warning, failure, danger, bug, example, quote

docs.title: Collapsible Sections
docs.text:
Markdown
??? note "Click to expand"
    Hidden content here

???+ note "Expanded by default"
    Visible content

docs.title: Code Blocks with Tabs
docs.text:
Markdown
=== "Python"

    ```python
    print("Hello")
    ```

=== "JavaScript"

    ```javascript
    console.log("Hello");
    ```

docs.title: Task Lists
docs.text:
Markdown
- [x] Completed task
- [ ] Pending task

docs.title: Diagrams (Mermaid)
docs.text:
Markdown
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Start] --> B[Process]
    B --> C[End]
```

docs.title: Keyboard Keys
docs.text:
Markdown
Press ++ctrl+c++ to copy

docs.title: Naming Conventions
docs.text:
• Use lowercase with hyphens: my-note-name.md
  • Be descriptive but concise
  • Use index.md for section landing pages

docs.title: Tags
docs.text:
Use consistent tags across notes:

Category Tags Cloud aws, azure, gcp, cloud Development python, javascript, go, development DevOps docker, kubernetes, terraform, cicd Security pentesting, ctf, security Learning certification, course, book

docs.title: Contributing New Templates
docs.text:
When creating a new template:

  1. Create the template in docs/_templates/
  2. Include comprehensive YAML frontmatter
  3. Add helpful placeholders and examples
  4. Document it in this README

docs.title: [Post Title]
docs.text: Brief introduction that hooks the reader.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Set the context. What problem are we solving? Why should the reader care?

docs.title: Background
docs.text: Any necessary background information the reader needs.

docs.title: The Problem
docs.text: Describe the problem or challenge in detail.

docs.title: Approach
docs.text: How we're going to solve it.

docs.title: Implementation
docs.text:
Step-by-step implementation details.

Text Only
// Key code examples

docs.title: Results
docs.text: What we achieved.

docs.title: Key Takeaways
docs.text:
1. Takeaway 1: Brief explanation
  2. Takeaway 2: Brief explanation
  3. Takeaway 3: Brief explanation

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text: Summarize what we covered and what the reader should do next.

docs.title: Exam Day Tips
docs.text:
Remember

  • Arrive early / test equipment
  • Read questions carefully
  • Flag difficult questions for review
  • Time management: X minutes per question
  • Eliminate obviously wrong answers first

docs.title: Cheatsheet
docs.text: title: [Tool Name] Cheatsheet date: created: YYYY-MM-DD updated: YYYY-MM-DD tags: - cheatsheet - tool-name

docs.title: [Tool Name] Cheatsheet
docs.text: Quick reference guide for [Tool Name].

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
macOSLinuxWindows Bash
brew install tool-name
Bash
apt install tool-name
# or
yum install tool-name
PowerShell
choco install tool-name
# or
winget install tool-name

docs.title: Basic Commands
docs.text: Command Description tool command1 What it does tool command2 What it does tool command3 What it does

docs.title: Common Flags
docs.text: Flag Long Form Description -v --verbose Verbose output -h --help Show help -q --quiet Quiet mode

docs.title: Use Case 1: [Description]
docs.text:
Bash
tool command --flag value

docs.title: Use Case 2: [Description]
docs.text:
Bash
tool command \
  --flag1 value1 \
  --flag2 value2

docs.title: Use Case 3: [Description]
docs.text:
Bash
tool command input output

docs.title: Example 1: [Task]
docs.text:
Bash
# Step 1
tool step1

# Step 2
tool step2

# Verify
tool verify

docs.title: Example 2: [Task]
docs.text:
Bash
# Complete workflow
tool workflow --all

• macOS/Linux: ~/.config/tool/config.yaml
  • Windows: %APPDATA%\tool\config.yaml

  option2: value

docs.title: Common Operations
docs.text:
Bash
# List resources
aws/az/gcloud command list

# Create
aws/az/gcloud command create --name NAME

# Delete
aws/az/gcloud command delete --name NAME

# Update
aws/az/gcloud command update --name NAME --setting VALUE

docs.title: Security Considerations
docs.text:
Security Best Practices

  • Enable encryption at rest
  • Use IAM roles (not keys)
  • Enable logging and monitoring
  • Implement least privilege access

    exploit()

# Configure environment

# Run development server
npm run dev

docs.title: Cheatsheet Template
docs.text:
Markdown
# Tool Name Cheatsheet

## Basic Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `cmd` | What it does |
| `cmd -flag` | What this flag does |

## Common Use Cases

### Use Case 1

\`\`\`bash
command example here
\`\`\`

### Use Case 2

\`\`\`bash
another command example
\`\`\`

## Tips & Tricks

- Useful tip 1
- Useful tip 2

## Resources

- [Official docs](url)

Quick Access

Bookmark this page for quick access to all cheatsheets.

docs.title: Useful Commands
docs.text:
Bash
# Configure AWS CLI
aws configure

# List S3 buckets
aws s3 ls

# Describe EC2 instances
aws ec2 describe-instances

# Get caller identity
aws sts get-caller-identity

Pro Tip

Use AWS CLI profiles for managing multiple accounts: Bash

aws configure --profile myprofile
aws s3 ls --profile myprofile

Bash

# Build binary

# Get dependencies

docs.title: Modern JavaScript
Node.js Essentials
docs.text:
Bash
# Initialize project
npm init -y

# Install dependencies
npm install express

# Run script
npm run dev

# Use pnpm (faster alternative)
pnpm install

docs.title: Python Notes
docs.text: Python programming language notes, libraries, and best practices.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text:
• Language fundamentals
  • Virtual environments
  • Package management (pip, poetry)
  • Type hints
  • Testing (pytest)
  • Web frameworks (FastAPI, Django, Flask)
  • Data science (pandas, numpy)

docs.title: Virtual Environments
docs.text:
Bash
# Create virtual environment
python -m venv .venv

# Activate (macOS/Linux)
source .venv/bin/activate

# Activate (Windows)
.venv\Scripts\activate

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Freeze dependencies
pip freeze > requirements.txt

docs.title: Common Patterns
docs.text:
Python
# Context manager
with open("file.txt", "r") as f:
    content = f.read()

# List comprehension
squares = [x**2 for x in range(10)]

# Dictionary comprehension
word_lengths = {word: len(word) for word in words}

# Type hints
def greet(name: str) -> str:
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

Use Poetry for modern Python projects

Poetry handles dependencies, virtual environments, and packaging in one tool. Bash

poetry init
poetry add requests
poetry shell

docs.text: IDEs, editors, utilities, and productivity tools.

docs.text:
• VS Code
  • Neovim
  • Git
  • GitHub CLI
  • Terminal tools (tmux, zsh)
  • HTTP clients (curl, httpie, Postman)

docs.title: Git Essentials
docs.text:
Bash
# Clone repository
git clone <url>

# Create branch
git checkout -b feature/my-feature

# Stage and commit
git add .
git commit -m "feat: add new feature"

# Push
git push -u origin feature/my-feature

# Rebase
git rebase main

# Interactive rebase
git rebase -i HEAD~3

docs.title: Useful Aliases
docs.text:
Bash
# Git aliases (~/.gitconfig)
[alias]
    co = checkout
    br = branch
    ci = commit
    st = status
    lg = log --oneline --graph

docs.title: DevOps Notes
docs.text: Container orchestration, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and operations.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text: Topic Description Docker Containerization and Docker best practices Kubernetes Container orchestration CI/CD Continuous Integration and Deployment Terraform Infrastructure as Code

docs.title: Key Concepts
docs.text:
• Container fundamentals
  • Orchestration patterns
  • GitOps workflows
  • Infrastructure as Code
  • Monitoring and observability
  • Secret management
  • Configuration management

docs.title: CI/CD Notes
docs.text: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment pipelines.

docs.title: Platforms
docs.text:
• GitHub Actions
  • GitLab CI
  • Jenkins
  • CircleCI
  • ArgoCD

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text:
YAML
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          cache: 'npm'

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci

      - name: Run tests
        run: npm test

      - name: Build
        run: npm run build

docs.title: Deployment Workflow
docs.text:
YAML
name: Deploy

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Deploy to production
        run: |
          # Deployment commands here
        env:
          DEPLOY_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.DEPLOY_TOKEN }}

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
CI/CD Best Practices

  • Keep pipelines fast (< 10 minutes)
  • Run tests in parallel
  • Cache dependencies
  • Use matrix builds for multiple environments
  • Implement proper secret management
  • Use environment-specific deployments

docs.title: Docker Notes
docs.text: Container fundamentals and Docker best practices.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text:
• Dockerfile best practices
  • Multi-stage builds
  • Docker Compose
  • Networking
  • Volumes and storage
  • Security

docs.title: Essential Commands
docs.text:
Bash
# Build image
docker build -t myapp:latest .

# Run container
docker run -d -p 8080:80 --name myapp myapp:latest

# List containers
docker ps -a

# View logs
docker logs -f myapp

# Execute command in container
docker exec -it myapp /bin/sh

# Stop and remove
docker stop myapp && docker rm myapp

# Remove unused resources
docker system prune -af

docs.title: Dockerfile Example
docs.text:
Docker
# Multi-stage build example
FROM node:20-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

FROM node:20-alpine AS runner
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=builder /app/dist ./dist
COPY --from=builder /app/node_modules ./node_modules
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["node", "dist/index.js"]

docs.title: Docker Compose
docs.text:
YAML
version: '3.8'
services:
  app:
    build: .
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=production
    depends_on:
      - db
  db:
    image: postgres:15
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
volumes:
  postgres_data:

docs.title: Kubernetes Notes
docs.text: Container orchestration with Kubernetes.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text:
• Core concepts (Pods, Services, Deployments)
  • ConfigMaps and Secrets
  • Ingress and networking
  • Persistent storage
  • Helm charts
  • Operators

docs.title: kubectl Commands
docs.text:
Bash
# Get resources
kubectl get pods
kubectl get services
kubectl get deployments

# Describe resource
kubectl describe pod <pod-name>

# Logs
kubectl logs -f <pod-name>

# Execute into pod
kubectl exec -it <pod-name> -- /bin/sh

# Apply manifest
kubectl apply -f deployment.yaml

# Delete resource
kubectl delete -f deployment.yaml

# Context management
kubectl config get-contexts
kubectl config use-context <context>

docs.title: Basic Deployment
docs.text:
YAML
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: myapp
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: myapp
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: myapp
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: myapp
        image: myapp:latest
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: "128Mi"
            cpu: "500m"
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: myapp-service
spec:
  selector:
    app: myapp
  ports:
  - port: 80
    targetPort: 8080
  type: ClusterIP

Use k9s for cluster management

k9s provides a terminal-based UI for Kubernetes clusters. Bash

brew install k9s
k9s

docs.title: Terraform Notes
docs.text: Infrastructure as Code with Terraform.

docs.title: Topics

  • Workspaces
  • Provider configuration
  • Best practices

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
Bash
# Initialize
terraform init

# Plan changes
terraform plan

# Apply changes
terraform apply

# Destroy resources
terraform destroy

# Format code
terraform fmt

# Validate configuration
terraform validate

# Show state
terraform state list
terraform state show <resource>

# Book Title

**Author:** Name
**Year:** YYYY
**Category:** Technical / Leadership / etc.
**Status:** Reading / Completed
**Rating:** X/5

## Summary

One paragraph summary of the book.

## Key Takeaways

1. Main lesson
2. Important concept
3. Practical application

## Chapter Notes

### Chapter 1: Title

Key points...

### Chapter 2: Title

Key points...

## Quotes

> "Notable quote from the book"

## How I'll Apply This

Practical applications of what I learned.

docs.title: Project Template
docs.text:
When documenting a project:

Markdown
# Project Name

**Status:** Planning / In Progress / Completed / Archived
**Start Date:** YYYY-MM-DD
**Technologies:** List of technologies used

## Overview

Brief description of the project and its purpose.

## Goals

- [ ] Primary goal
- [ ] Secondary goal
- [ ] Stretch goal

## Architecture

Describe the system architecture, components, and how they interact.

## Technical Decisions

### Decision 1: Choice Made

**Context:** Why was this decision needed?
**Options Considered:**
1. Option A - pros/cons
2. Option B - pros/cons

**Decision:** What we chose and why.

## Setup

Instructions for setting up the project locally.

## Lessons Learned

What went well, what didn't, and what I learned.

## Future Improvements

Ideas for future enhancements.

docs.text:
When adding a new writeup, use this structure:

Markdown
# Challenge Name

**Platform:** HackTheBox / TryHackMe / etc.
**Category:** Web / Crypto / Pwn / etc.
**Difficulty:** Easy / Medium / Hard
**Date:** YYYY-MM-DD

## Description

Brief description of the challenge.

## Reconnaissance

Initial enumeration steps.

## Solution

Step-by-step solution.

## Flag

`flag{example_flag_here}`

## Lessons Learned

Key takeaways from this challenge.

docs.title: Common Tools
docs.text:
Bash
# Crypto
python -c "import base64; print(base64.b64decode('...'))"

# Steganography
steghide extract -sf image.jpg
strings image.jpg
exiftool image.jpg

# Binary analysis
file binary
strings binary
ltrace ./binary

docs.title: Pentesting Notes
docs.text: Penetration testing methodologies and techniques.

docs.title: Phases
docs.text:
• Reconnaissance
  • Scanning & Enumeration
  • Exploitation
  • Post-Exploitation
  • Reporting

docs.title: Passive Recon
docs.text:
Bash
# Subdomain enumeration
subfinder -d target.com

# OSINT
theHarvester -d target.com -b all

# DNS records
dig target.com any

docs.title: Active Recon
docs.text:
Bash
# Port scanning
nmap -sC -sV -oA scan target.com

# Full port scan
nmap -p- --min-rate 10000 target.com

# UDP scan
nmap -sU --top-ports 100 target.com

docs.title: Common Vulnerabilities
docs.text:
• SQL Injection
  • XSS (Cross-Site Scripting)
  • CSRF
  • SSRF
  • XXE
  • Authentication flaws
  • Authorization issues

docs.title: Tools
docs.text:
Bash
# Directory fuzzing
ffuf -w /path/to/wordlist -u https://target.com/FUZZ

# Web vulnerability scanning
nikto -h target.com

# Burp Suite (GUI)
burpsuite

Legal Disclaimer

Only perform penetration testing on systems you have explicit authorization to test.

docs.title: Security Tools
docs.text: Security tools and utilities reference.

docs.title: Reconnaissance
docs.text: Tool Purpose Nmap Port scanning and service detection Amass Subdomain enumeration Shodan Internet-wide scanning database Censys Security research platform

docs.title: Web Application
docs.text: Tool Purpose Burp Suite Web proxy and scanner OWASP ZAP Open-source web security scanner ffuf Web fuzzer sqlmap SQL injection tool

docs.title: Password & Hashing
docs.text: Tool Purpose Hashcat Password recovery John the Ripper Password cracking Hydra Online password attacking

docs.title: Network
docs.text: Tool Purpose Wireshark Network protocol analyzer tcpdump Command-line packet analyzer Responder LLMNR/NBT-NS poisoning

docs.title: Nmap
docs.text:
Bash
# Quick scan
nmap -sV target.com

# Full scan
nmap -sC -sV -p- -oA full_scan target.com

# Vulnerability scan
nmap --script vuln target.com

docs.title: Hashcat
docs.text:
Bash
# MD5
hashcat -m 0 hash.txt wordlist.txt

# SHA-256
hashcat -m 1400 hash.txt wordlist.txt

# NTLM
hashcat -m 1000 hash.txt wordlist.txt

docs.title: ffuf
docs.text:
Bash
# Directory fuzzing
ffuf -w wordlist.txt -u https://target.com/FUZZ

# Parameter fuzzing
ffuf -w params.txt -u https://target.com?FUZZ=value
